Job_Title: 【EC業界】財務・経理マネジャー
Job_Descriptions: Job Description 東証一部上場のグローバルファームにて、財務・経理マネジャーを募集しております。 ビジネスの中核を成す開発組織のファイナンス情報全般を扱う部署でご活躍いただきます。 【具体的な業務内容】 - 事業と開発部門の経営陣に必要な情報のマネージメント業務 - 開発費用の予実管理 - 部署の予算・執行状況の管理・レポーティング業務 - 開発部署の予算策定・予実管理・経営層へのレポーティング - 定期的な各開発部署の執行計画のヒアリング - 予算管理システムへのデータ入力 - 予実差異の分析とレポート - デイリーオペレーション業務の効率化と改善の提案 Job Function General Affair/Admin, Financial Accounting, Accounting support, Tax/GST, Partial of full set (AP, AR, Bookkeeping), Sales Coordinator Job Description Our client is a Japanese Manufacturer, they are looking for Admin Officer to join their team. 【 What you will be doing 】 - General Admin work. - Prepare cash flow table and fixed asset & AP/AR & inventory. - Perform budgets and monthly reports on budgets. - Handle the full spectrum of company accounts including general ledger (GL), accounts payable (AP), accounts receivable (AR) functions. - Issue invoices, payment slips, and tracking payments. - GST computation and claims submissions. - Report to Japan HQ. - Any other duties/tasks as assigned. Job Description Our Client is a MAS license Financial Institution. The role of a Finance Manager is an individual contributor role. You will be required to perform as hands-on Accounts and Finance related role. 【What you will be working on】 - Manage Overall Accounting for the company as well as other local and global subsidiary companies. - Managing and processing of accounts payable, accounts receivable for separate entities and vendors on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis. - Review month end reports to ensure financial statements are prepared in accordance with local accounting standards with external accountant. - Support all group entities for auditing, liaising with auditors, assist in financial year-end audit and attend to any audit queries from external audits. - Assist in the preparation of annual financial budget and forecast exercise. - Monitor and manage cashflow forecast for all bank accounts. - Review and ensure timely submission of GST return and ensure compliance with corporate tax, GST and withholding tax. - Reconcile financial discrepancies though analyzing and collecting information. - Assist Compliance Officer in preparation of reports to be submitted to Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) and other statutory and regulatory reporting. Job Description My client is a Japanese travel agency. They are currently looking for an Accounting Manager to manage the team. 【What you will be working on】 - Manages the accounting team (Inbound and Outbound Department) - Ensures complete, accurate, and timely submission of all management reports of the company for the regional office and Japan HQ; and all statutory reports required by the Government. - Ensure compliance with accounting standards and policies, regulations and, internal controls - Perform analysis, budgeting, planning, and back-office support functions to ensure the success of the business - Liaise with Corporate Secretary to ensure timely submission of Audited financial statements for ACRA filing and preparation of Directors' Resolution - Performs other related duties as necessary or assigned Benefit 【What they are offering】 - Variable Bonus: (Depending on Company and Individual performance) - Annual Leave : 18 days - Marriage, Birthday & Examination Leave - Medical Benefit (capped at SGD500 per FY) - Dental Benefit & Optical benefit (capped at SGD200 per FY) - Annual Health Screening - Group Insurance that covers Life, Critical Illness, Hospitalization/Surgical, Personal accident - Staff Discount Job Description Prominent corporate bank with global presence is now seeking qualified candidate for Officer / Senior officer, Credit Analysis to join their friendly and exciting team! 【What will you be working on】 - Gather information about clients and reading financial briefings of invested companies - Assess, analyse and interpret complicated financial information related to corporate bond - Analyze corporate cash flow and macroeconomy - Visit and meet investing companies and collect information - Find new investable companies Benefit 【What they are offering】 - Variable Bonus （Depends on the company and individual performance） - Annual Leave: 23 days - Medical Leave: 14 days

Job Description: • Responsible for the execution of end-to-end HR operational processes and transactions according to standard operating procedures • Provide dashboards and reports to for internal & external consumption • Re-engineer existing processes to streamline and develop changed processes to obtain optimal operational efficiency. • Partner with internal stakeholders to ensure completion of HR processes • Process the application, renewal and termination of  passes according to the latest statutory regulations or requirements • Prepare HR letters and other documents in a timely and accurate manner • Render support to annual HR exercises such as performance appraisal, annual declaration, etc. • Prepare statutory submissions and ensure that HR processes are in compliant with applicable government regulations • Provide dashboards and reports to for internal & external consumption • Any other duties as assigned Suitable candidates, please email resume in MS word format to **********@recruitexpress.com.sg. Attention: Brendan Low Shun Wei (CEI Reg No: R1104469) Recruit Express Pte Ltd EA License No: 99C4599 We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Site Name: Singapore - Tuas Posted Date: Feb 4 2022 Professional Conversion Program (PCP) is an initiative jointly supported by Workforce Singapore (WSG) and Temasek Polytechnic (TP) and is aimed at building a pipeline of skilled manpower for Singapore’s biopharmaceutical manufacturing industry in anticipation of hiring demand. The training programme is consists of a 3-months structured facilitated training conducted by TP, followed by 15 months of local attachment with GSK.  Due to the nature of the programme, we can only consider Singapore Citizens and Singapore Permanent Residents. For more information, please visit A certificate will be given to successful trainees upon completion of the programme. Quality Assurance (QA) for QC oversight The role is required to perform QA oversight for QC operations related to QC testing, compliance review of joblists, deviation/CAPA/change control management and SOP revisions. The training program will help to train the personnel to be familiar with QC Operations and good understanding of GMP requirements associated with QC operations. What qualifications do I need to apply? A degree holder with either Chemical engineering, Biological or Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Science, or any related Science background. A good team Player. Has a good eye for details. Keen to learn and be trained. Other requirements: Singaporean (core priority) or Singapore PR only – for Program and Grant requirement For male applicants: completed National Service within 60 months prior to course start. Where will I be based? You will be based at one of our manufacturing sites in Singapore near Tuas. When can I start? PCP Program starts in May 2022 (tentatively), while the On the Job training start in Aug 2022. How can I apply? Applications are now open. Click on the button above to apply. Applications close 15 Mar 2022 (We recommend you apply as soon as possible, because we accept ongoing applications and offer positions on a first come, first served basis!) At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We strive to make our recruitment process free of bias of any kind and aim to create an inclusive workplace at GSK. If you require any assistance, either to attend an interview or during the course of the recruitment process, please let us know. Why GSK Uniting science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together At GSK, we have already delivered unprecedented change over the past four years, improving R&D, becoming a leader in Consumer Healthcare, strengthening our leadership, and transforming our commercial execution. Now, we’re making the most significant changes we’ve made to our business in over 20 years. We’re on track to separate and create two new companies in 2022: New GSK with a leading portfolio of vaccines and specialty medicines as well as R&D based on immune system and genetics science; and a new world-leading consumer healthcare company of loved and trusted brands. With new ambition comes new purpose. For New GSK, this is to unite science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together – all with the clear ambition of delivering human health impact; stronger and more sustainable shareholder returns; and as a new GSK where outstanding people thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it. How we do all this is through our people and our culture. A culture that is ambitious for patients – so we deliver what matters better and faster; accountable for impact – with clear ownership of goals and support to succeed; and where we do the right thing. So, if you’re ready to improve the lives of billions, join us at this exciting moment in our journey. Join our challenge to get Ahead Together. *Li-GSK Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing. Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Responsibilities: • Responsible for end-to-end processing of monthly payroll computation for all employees ensuring legislative compliance; • Perform payroll verification and review of external vendor deliverables • Lead in the implementation of current system to Cloud based system for greater efficiency • Update payroll system on new information and review changes pertaining to existing or new employees’ details; • Assist in monthly, annual and periodic filings of statutory payment submissions notwithstanding, IR21, Yearly IR8A,  Government Leave claims; • Keep abreast of changes or amendments to new statutory rules, regulations and internal policies of clients and in response, plan and implement changes to payroll processes or system to ensure compliance; Requirements: Minimum Diploma, Degree in HR, Business or relevant field At least 7 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Supervisory experience is required for this role Preferably Senior Executives specializing in payroll for MNCs handling 300 or more inclusive of blue and white collar staff Experience using Timesoft payroll Suitable candidates, please email resume in MS word format to **********@recruitexpress.com.sg. Attention: Brendan Low Shun Wei (CEI Reg No: R1104469) Recruit Express Pte Ltd EA License No: 99C4599 We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Company Description Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive. When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement. Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone. Job Description As a Senior Software Engineer you will help lead, design, enhance and build our solutions for customers in an agile, fast-paced environment. You will be working with colleagues across the company, who will help support and challenge you every day. Designing solutions, writing code, unit testing code, reviewing code and frequent check-ins for continuous integration is just part of your DNA. You will see your code going to production in just a few weeks and used by strategic accounts worldwide. If this sounds exciting, we would love to chat and tell you more about our work culture, solutions and opportunities. Your responsibilities will include: Design and develop new systems as well as enhancements and fixing defects in existing software. Leverage newer technologies and develop solutions to build the next generation of payment solutions. Help our clients achieve their business goals by understanding their requirements and delivering the best solution. Act as Feature Lead for efforts to design and implement various aspects of secure payment solutions. Periodically rotate into the role of Scrum Master to lead agile, scrum teams for a given sprint. Able to take up QA responsibilities from time to time to functionally test features end-to-end, since we expect everyone to be able to perform DEV and QA tasks in a unified engineering team. Actively participate in meetings and discussions with product and architecture teams. Excellent interpersonal skills along with a team player focus, with an ability to hone leadership skills over time and work as a mentor to junior team members. Develop close working relationships with members of teams within the organization. Become knowledgeable of Visa's core technology, infrastructure and standards. Qualifications Basic Qualifications Bachelors/Degree in Computer Science or other technology field; Typically candidates are expected to have 4-6 years of experience working in a technology company on Java and related technologies. Preferred Qualifications We want our Senior Software Engineers to do much more than just write code. You would be expected to bring in expertise that include: 4-6 years of solid Experience in technologies including JAVA, J2EE, REST, ORACLE and more. Good Experience with Spring Framework and Hibernate is a must-have. Any additional experience with a MVC Framework like Spring MVC, Struts, etc. is a Plus. Strong foundation in requirements scoping, data structures, algorithms, instrumenting and performance benchmarking, problem solving and complexity analysis. 4-6 years demonstrated experience with n-tier web application development and experience in latest JDK and earlier releases. Must be able to articulate experience with many of the major Java APIS (e.g. JMS, JPA, JNDI, JAX, etc.); Java / J2EE certification a Plus. Experience with web services standards and related technologies (XML, JSON, REST, SOAP, WS*, AXIS, JERSEY) is required. Demonstrable experience utilizing object-oriented patterns and design best practices. Experience working with a variety of Application Servers and Databases (At least Tomcat, Oracle or equivalent). Experience in UI technologies like HTML, CSS, Javascript, AJAX is a Plus. Exposure to Node JS and understanding of Javascript and it’s intricacies is desirable. The ideal candidate would be one having full stack development experience and flexible to work both on backend or frontend depending on the project backlog. Exposure to tools like JMeter, SoapUI is good to have to carry out QA tasks. Good understanding of multi-threaded concurrent programming is needed. Experience with non-blocking IO is an added Plus. Familiarity with common application security vulnerabilities and how to overcome them (OWASP) is a Plus. Our engineers do more than just write and test code and we need managers for them to go beyond just supervising them: We count on your curiosity and creativity, to want to understand customer requirements and our processes and want to come up with creative solutions. While you’ll have the skill to see and understand the big picture, you’re able to stay focused on the task at hand to achieve immediate goals. You’re great at systematic and accurate research wanting to uncover the smallest detail. You have amazing work ethics that will help us all work extremely well together. You have the passion to understand people and always strive harder to improve our products and services! You have excellent interpersonal skills and above all, you are a team player! Hands on experience with Continuous Integration, and Test Driven Development is required. Additional Information Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Job Description: Inspection of Plant and site; Implementation of safety requirement; Responsible in coordinating, implementing and monitoring the workplace and environmental health and safety plan; Under the WSH Act, employees have a duty to keep their workplace and colleagues safe: Cooperate with employers and follow safety and health procedure; Report unsafe acts and incidents; Do not tamper with safety devices or perform wilful or reckless acts; and Be responsible for any other duties that may be assigned from time to time as your superior/management deem fit. Job Requirements: Minimum qualification GCE “O” level, ITE certificate/ Diploma; Possess WSQ Advanced Certificate in WSH (Level B); Any safety related certificate will be an added advantage; Possess knowledge of Workplace Safety and Health Act and relevant COP implementation; Possess own transport and/or Class 3 licence will be an added advantage; and At least 2 years of work experience relevant to the work to be carried out by a WSH Coordinator. We offer an attractive salary package that commensurates with experience. We also provide vast opportunities for career advancement. If you're interested in the position, email your cover letter, detailed resume, current and expected salary to:

As an engineer in this team, the individual will be involved in the plan, build and run activities related to database technology and infrastructure. The role will contribute to the design/architect, solution engineering, and support; will be responsible for delivering database projects, maintaining the running systems, able to perform problem analysis and troubleshooting. The individual should be well versed in database administration and engineering practices and principles.  The individual will share the responsibility of overall database build, deployment and support. He or she will provide technical influence and subject matter expertise for the database team, responsible for solving complex problems and taking a broad perspective to identify innovative solutions. The role serves as a technical/functional specialist and works independently with guidance only in the most complex situations. RESPONSIBILITIES: Primarily the architecture, engineering, deployment and support of NoSQL database technology. Support Database Platform Engineering in the architecture, development and deployment of NoSQL technologies like Open source Cassandra, DataStax Cassandra and/or MongoDB/any other NoSQL Technologies in high SLA environments. Support of RDBMS technology will be a plus. This includes, but is not limited to, advanced to expert engineering and implementation of the following: * Manage, support and maintain database technology and infrastructure, adhering to the architectural guidelines and policies. * Database administration for off the shelf and internally developed applications, ensure continuous 24x7 operation and availability in support of mission critical business applications and participating in on-call rotation. * Install, configure, monitor, upgrade and maintain MongoDB and Cassandra databases in production and non-production environments. * Participate in Database Maintenance and DR activities. * Write/maintain OS level scripts for DB automation and application maintenance. * Provide technical expertise and hands-on support in consolidation and migration of databases to new hardware and platforms. * Physical implementation of databases, storage structures, high-availability solutions, replication, and disaster recovery solutions. * Proactive and reactive performance analysis, monitoring, troubleshooting and resolution of escalated Level 2 and Level3 issues. * Regular database capacity planning related to database growth and system utilization, trend analysis, predictive future database resource requirements, and the structured organized reporting of the same. * Work closely with other Infrastructure engineering, product development, business operations, and technical operations to ensure delivery of database services within the SLA’s and performance targets. * Adapt business requirements, model data, and develop database specifications, table and element attributes. * Participate in the evaluation, selection and implementation of DBA tools to improve the effectiveness of tasks such as performance monitoring and tuning, recovery, and database change management processing. * Ability to work well as a team and as an individual with minimal supervision.

Job Description Due to COVID-19 travel and entry restrictions, this year’s Graduate and Internship opportunities are only available to candidates with the right to work in Singapore. We will review and adjust this approach as appropriate for future programs. The Associate Technical Writer is an entry-level position.  As an Associate Technical Writer with TCS, you will work with technical experts across our global organization to document sophisticated payment technology systems, services, and applications.  You will be mentored by senior-level writers who will help you to navigate TCS’ documentation and editing services and to understand industry best practices. You will work on a variety of technical documentation projects, gaining expertise in authoring tools and publishing environments as you research, write, and edit technical content for document libraries, help systems, SharePoint sites, intranet sites, and more. Responsibilities: Work with senior-level writers to: Research subject matter and obtain and exchange information Create and maintain project schedule(s) Represent writing team in planning and review meetings with project cross-functional stakeholders Communicate status of project to team members, clients, and departmental management Proactively escalate problems and issues as needed Multi-task and prioritize assignments Analyze existing documentation for impacts and update them accordingly. Manage and maintain content for customized document editions (profiling) and publishing to various media (single-sourcing). Manage and store master documentation files, complete quality artifacts, update metrics, and implement other processes as directed by the department procedures guide. May also perform technical tasks to support TCS technical staff and developers in maintaining and enhancing publishing tools, systems, and templates. Qualifications Graduates or candidates pursuing a degree in Information Systems, English, Journalism, Communications, Technical Communications, or a related technology-focused field. Proficient with written and verbal communication for domestic and global audiences, business and technical alike. Highly driven, enthusiastic, eager, collaborative, and resourceful. Strong customer service, analytical, research, interpersonal and problem solving skills. Strong ability to collaborate with multicultural teams across the globe. Experienced with MS-Office products for Windows including Word, Excel, Visio, and SharePoint. (preferred) Experienced with graphics editing software such as Illustrator, Photoshop, PaintShop Pro, and Web design tools (DreamWeaver, Wiki, SharePoint Designer).  (preferred) Familiar with advanced authoring software (Adobe FrameMaker, Acrobat, and RoboHelp), XML editing tools (Oxygen Editor), document repositories (Tridion).  (a plus) Additional Information Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Job Description Summary You will independently operate mechanical cleaning processes for all shops' component repair operations. Job Description Essential Responsibilities: Perform grit blast, shot peen, glass peen, tumble, ultrasonic, vapor blast, etching, water flow, turbo jet washer, blade flusher, plastisol injection, plastisol burnout and barrel finishing, honey comb seal removal Perform necessary pre-checks before operations Ensure all production data are filled in correctly in the Log Book Ensure process and certification are in line with due date Differentiate the different tumbler, shot and glass peening machine utilization Perform daily maintenance checklist and ensure safe working practices Perform scheduled maintenance & housekeeping tasks Qualifications/Requirements: Minimum GCE 'O' level with 3 years of relevant experience Basic command of written and spoken English Desired Characteristics: Exposure in operating tumbler and peening machines Able to perform quality audits and pre-production qualification procedures Able to multi task and ensure proper documentation and handling of log books Able to operate manual and auto grit blast machine Discipline and strict adherence to Operating and Quality procedures Fully understand process parameters and able to produce good quality parts Willing to work in a hot and noisy environment A team player Humble: respectful, receptive, agile, eager to learn Transparent: shares critical information, speaks with candor, contributes constructively Focused: quick learner, strategically prioritizes work, committed Leadership ability: strong communicator, decision-maker, collaborative Problem solver: analytical-minded, challenges existing processes, critical thinker Additional Information Relocation Assistance Provided: No

Job Description Summary • Facilitate a team of NDT Inspectors in the inspection of repaired and manufactured parts. • Ensure that all equipment, chemicals and material used for NDT meets the applicable specification requirements. • Has overall responsibility for the following : 1.New NDT process or technique introduction Applynducting training and examination of NDT personnel 3.NDT process Improvement 4. Auditing of NDT process and suppliers 5. Focal point for Engineering issues on NDT 6. Focal point for NDT on audits by external agencies. 7. NDT Support on new product initiation. Job Description Essential Responsibilities • Facilitate, train and coordinate the activities of the NDT teams. Impart proper skills towards processing and inspection of all parts to ensure the needs for business in terms of inspection services are met as a result of an efficient and high performing team. • Look after proper maintenance of NDT inspection systems so that they meet the requirements of regulating agencies. • Coordinate radiation-emitting area and personnel to be in compliance with all radiation safety regulations. • Maintain personnel expertise and formal certification in the appropriate NDT disciplines. • Develop the NDT staff with sufficient training and formal certification so that the needs of the business are adequately covered, including back-up. • Develop and approve NDT Standard Operating Procedures, work instruction and techniques. • Function as the primary technical interface and engineering resource on all NDT-related issues. (Preferable covering Radiography, FPI, UT, ECI) • Constantly explore and seek better ways and more efficient methods of allowing the business to perform NDT in the most optimal manner. Qualifications / Requirements • Degree (Engineering or Material Science) or equivalent with 6 years of relevant experience excluding level 2. • Diploma (Engineering or Material Science) or equivalent with 12 years of relevant experience excluding level 2 • ASNT NDT LEVEL 3, PT, ET, UT & RT • NAS 410 /EN4179 3 , PT, ET, UT & RT • PCN/AERO Level 3, PT, ET, UT & RT Desired Characteristics • Knowledge and experience on the following NDT process: PT : Method A and D ( Manual and Automated) UT: Contact A scan and immersion C scan ET: Manual and Automated RT: Film / Filmless ( CR, DDA & CT) • Strong Level 2 skill in PT, ET , UT & RT • CAAS AME N11, N12, N13, N14 and N15 • CAAS Air Legislation Paper M10, L11 or L12 • Knowledge of manufacturing process and product technology • Dynamic with Leadership skill • Facilitation skill • Good command of written/spoken English • Basic knowledge of PC software • knowledge and experience in NADCAP checklist AC 7114/1 and AC 7114/4 Additional Information Relocation Assistance Provided: No

Job Description The Staff Systems Engineer will be part of a global high performing team responsible for application development, production application support and maintenance of the critical Advanced Authorization suite of Risk applications.  The Risk applications make use of predictive modelling to analyze historical and current data to predict fraud risk for authorization transactions, thus enabling Visa Issuers to manage associated risk.  The role requires a strong understanding of software engineering process, application support, deployment, troubleshooting in open systems environments.  The ideal candidate will be a technically competent individual and have demonstrated expertise in supporting critical production environment in 24x7 and team focused spirit.  The candidate will work closely with peers in development and test engineering team within Network Processing as well as other cross functional groups across the organization. Responsibilities: Work with a team of engineers for the development and production support of Network Processing Risk Applications. Provide rotation basis 24x7 production support to all Risk suite of applications in the production environment. Work with cross-functional teams to ensure minimum to no disruption to the Risk application services. Diagnose and resolve problems in production to meet all service level agreements (SLAs), including possible joint analysis session with cross region team, e.g. development team, infrastructure team, to ensure that our production systems are always available and provide whatever efforts is required to achieve this absolute objective. Work closely with the development and QA teams to develop install plans, define release schedule and content.  Implement changes in the production environment. Take full ownership of the change end-to-end, including plan, communication, engage, execution and follow-up with all required groups e.g. Sysadmins, middleware, database etc. Champion security, work with cybersecurity team to ensure all security vulnerabilities are remediated within required resolution timeline.  You must deliver software and systems support to the highest level of security at Visa. Code & unit test system components and applications in a range of programming languages, including developing tools for automation of routine tasks using industry standard programming and scripting languages. Create and Maintain technical documentation. Work collaboratively across team in Singapore and US to ensure high quality deliverables. Work independently with minimal guidance becoming a mentor and role model for other team members, active in developing new skills and adapt to organization and business need. Qualifications Basic Qualifications • Must have minimum 5+ years of experience in developing and supporting mission-critical applications systems in a high availability business environment and comfortable working in Linux environment. • Proven track record in problem solving, troubleshooting and analytical skills • Ability to develop tools and scripts to support automation need. Preferred Qualifications • Prior software engineering experience, familiar with software development lifecycle phases, agile framework including SAFe. • 5+ years of experience in design and implementation, comfortable in scripting or languages, e.g. Java, C++, Python, Go. • Experience with software build, regression, and defect tracking tools e.g. Git, Maven, Jira, and Jenkins. • Experience with Splunk, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, etc., production end-to-end monitoring tools exposure with SRE. • Good understanding of IT infrastructure in Linux server, Storage, Network, Databases for application troubleshooting • Good understanding of database concepts, MySQL and/or MSSQL and Cassandra. • Experience with IBM MQ, Kafka, etc., Middleware software. • Experience in Kubernetes, containerization technologies, e.g. Docker, will be added advantage. • Energetic individual keen with AIOps, or developing AIOps tools, to modernize operation supports • Flexible attitude, team player, highly driven individual, ready to work with multiple time zones cross-geographical teams • Excellent verbal and written communication and attention to detail skills. • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or a related technical discipline is required. Please Note: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic and the evolving visa/travel restrictions in place, we are currently only able to extend offers to candidates with the right to work in Singapore. We are keeping the situation under close review and will adjust accordingly should the restrictive measures be lifted. Additional Information

Job_Title: Senior Data Scientist – Visa Consulting & Analytics
Job_Descriptions: Team Summary Visa's Consulting and Data Science team is a key part of the Global Solutions organization; a high-performing team of data scientists, data analysts and statisticians helping major organizations adapt and evolve to meet the changes taking place in technology, finance, and commerce; with cutting-edge, creative and advanced analytic solutions. Visa is looking for Senior Data Scientist, who will be the Subject Matter Expert in creating machine learning and deep learning solutions. The successful candidate will lead data science lab engagements with clients & co-create solutions with Visa & client data to solve complex problems. What a Manager, DS does at Visa: Specific responsibilities will include: Work with Client & Visa data to co create analytical solutions using DS techniques Building & helping our partners to build data science capabilities & analytical solutions to solve their business problems Drive innovation through using data science techniques Collaborate with teams to build a strong worldwide machine learning and deep learning community. Act as data science advocate within our partners, advising and coaching analytical teams and sharing best practices and case studies. Continually look at the environment to challenge our assumptions around new sources of data, potential analytics partners, tools, talent and infrastructure. Explore leading methodologies and best practices to other teams and importing successful methodologies from other international markets Why this is important to Visa Visa's Consulting and Data Science team is a key part of the Global Solutions organization; a high-performing team of data scientists, data analysts and statisticians helping major organizations adapt and evolve to meet the changes taking place in technology, finance, and commerce; with cutting-edge, creative and advanced analytic solutions. The purpose of this team is to help Visa’s clients to grow their business & solve their problems by providing consulting services through visa data.

Responsibilities Responsible for providing production support and automation for extract, transform, load (ETL) applications that run large distributed batch processing involving petabytes of data in Hadoop Eco System Deliver research requests and participating in 24x7 on-call support Monitor processing, and ensuring timely execution, delivery, and availability Detect technical issues, perform root cause analysis, and identify permanent solutions to fix problems as needed Set audits and alerts to detect problems, and facilitate maintenance activities Plan and execute changes as per instructions, and strictly adhere to the processes and guidelines relating to change, incident, and problem management Run problem bridges by collaborating with others from different functional and technical areas and escalating as needed to resolve problems in a timely manner. Responsible for identifying knowledge gaps and providing technical guidance to team members as needed Provide updates and contribute to the team’s knowledge repository Engage in knowledge transition as well as research and analysis activities to find solutions to various business and technical problems Evaluate alternative methods, and present recommendations and justifications to management Identify improvement opportunities, and build Automation as well as engaging in performance tuning and data fixing activities Participate in and making recommendations to capacity planning activities Analyze code, understand business rules, and trace data, while following the process flow to investigate data-related issues Perform exports, backups, and data extracts as required from different environments Responsible for Data Fixes, Code Hot fixes Responsible for Research/Analysis Work to answer questions Job holder must have flexibility to work in shifts and during weekends and extended hours when needed

Cashier  Know POS machines Coffee Brewer Able to prepare coffee/tea base and serve beverage base on customers' requests. Lobby cleaning Able to clean lobby for customers to sit down Washing of cups, saucers and bowls, plates

The Staff Software Engineer would be a part of a high-performance global team responsible for the delivery of features in the Resolve Online program. As a key member of the delivery execution team, candidate would need to create scalable designs, write maintainable code, reusable components/services/utilities, and test cases. Qualifications include good organizational skills, strong analytical and problem-solving skills, good time management skills, ability to work independently, and effectively communicate with team members. The candidate must be capable of working in all phases of the application system development life cycle. The successful candidate will become a recognized Subject Matter Expert, responsible for contributing to the development and implementation of dispute processing capabilities for Visa Resolve Online application. Responsibilities: Understand business domain, analyze requirements, evaluate options and participate in scoping and sizing activities Design, develop code, tests and maintain code for Resolve online application releases Communicate and collaborate effectively with team members including vendor partner teams Effectively participate in the technology proof-of-concepts and learn new technologies and frameworks Understand and enhance coding guidelines and participate in code review processes Create and maintain technical documentation Collaborate with Requirements & Analysis group, QA team and Production Support team to ensure project alignment Service excellence and innovation; create opportunities; consistently think and act ahead of the curve

Job_Title: Sr. Systems Administrator – IRE Storage Services
Job_Descriptions: POSITION SUMMARY This Staff Systems Engineer position is within the Storage Engineering Team and falls under Global Systems Engineering.  This position will evaluate, architect, design, build, test, and document new storage and backup infrastructure, as well as serve as a Level 3 escalation point for existing infrastructure.  This position is expected to interact with Finance, Sourcing, Asset Management, Product Development, Operations, Audit and Risk, and various groups within Technology and Operations. This role must have strong communication and analytical skills, and prior experience in driving process improvements. This role should be able to mentor other team members and function as the technology lead on key infrastructure initiatives. This role is expected to participate in devising the technology strategy and engineering standards for Visa’s Storage infrastructure. RESPONSIBILITIES Responsible for the design, implementation, security and availability of Storage, Backups and SAN infrastructure, based on business requirements while adhering to tight operations, security, and procedural models Responsible for complex provisioning, advanced maintenance, data replication, disaster recovery, data migration and documentation for our Open Systems Storage and Backup environments Demonstrate a high level of technical expertise to support complex Storage & Backup devices, including SAN, NAS and Backup solutions across all tiers, under minimal supervision Operate in complex, highly-secure, highly-available, operations-centric datacenter environments and interact with other technology domain experts as required, to build and maintain the Open Systems Storage and Backups solutions in those datacenter environments Function as the Storage lead on key infrastructure projects and initiatives Write technical design and build documentation for storage infrastructure Develop ITIL procedures, technology strategy, engineering standards, methodologies, task-plans and best practices for Storage Engineering Work with other Engineering disciplines to develop Reference Architectures and technology standards based on Infrastructure Building Blocks, that can be offered as services to our internal customers Mentor junior team members Participate in “On-call” support rotation

Company Description Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive. When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement. Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone. Job Description Push Payments is a strategic initiative at Visa, focused on building the next generation payment network connecting, individuals and businesses with banks, fin-tech players, countries and regions with the flexibility to use a variety of payment instruments. Part of the broader Digital and Developer Platform organization, Push Payments team is looking to hire the best and brightest technologists with ambition and drive to build the next generation of payment network that would further extend the reach and scale of Visa’s payment network. This is once in a lifetime opportunity and you feel excited about joining and leading the revolution- come join us! We are looking for a talented Senior Software Engineer to join our team in Singapore! As a Senior Software Engineer you will help lead, design, enhance and build our solutions for customers in an agile, fast-paced environment. You will be working with colleagues across the company, who will help support and challenge you every day. Designing solutions, writing code, unit testing code, reviewing code and frequent check-ins for continuous integration is just part of your DNA. You will see your code going to production in just a few weeks and used by strategic accounts worldwide. If this sounds exciting, we would love to chat and tell you more about our work culture, solutions and opportunities. Our team, as well as our group works under the principles of a common engineering model with both development and testing expertise. You are expected to have hands-on experience and sufficient knowledge to contribute on both fronts as needed. Your responsibilities will include: Design and develop new systems as well as enhancements and fixing defects in existing software. Leverage newer technologies and develop solutions to build the next generation of payment solutions. Help our clients achieve their business goals by understanding their requirements and delivering the best solution. Act as Feature Lead for efforts to design and implement various aspects of secure payment solutions. Periodically rotate into the role of Scrum Master to lead agile, scrum teams for a given sprint. Able to take up QA responsibilities from time to time to functionally test features end-to-end, since we expect everyone to be able to perform DEV and QA tasks in a unified engineering team. Actively participate in meetings and discussions with product and architecture teams. Excellent interpersonal skills along with a team player focus, with an ability to hone leadership skills over time and work as a mentor to junior team members. Develop close working relationships with members of teams within the organization. Become knowledgeable of Visa's core technology, infrastructure and standards. Qualifications Additional Information

Job_Title: Staff Software Engineer in Test (Automation Test Engineer)
Job_Descriptions: Company Description Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive. When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement. Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone. Job Description Position Summary VROL is Visa's Global Dispute Management System - a mandated service that is crucial to the Visa brand promise of providing secure and reliable payment services by ensuring that cardholders, merchants, and issuing financial institutions have a clear dispute process and enabling technology, making resolution of disputed transactions fast and easy.  As part of the VROL Test Engineering team in the Network Processing organization, you'll be responsible for designing and implementing test automation solutions, development, implementation, maintenance and support of tools and automation framework. You will be a pivotal technical leader within the team to ensure the continued development of innovative solutions. This role requires quick problem-solving skills, logical thinking, and the application of programming techniques to design, build, and test code. Deep knowledge of computer science fundamentals is a plus. In addition to the technical skillset, the candidate will be a self-starter, results-driven, and equipped with excellent verbal and written communication skills. Key Responsibilities Design, develop and implement scalable automation solutions – create conceptual documents with a focus on improving test automation coverage Participate in Agile methodology and work with Scrum Teams Collaborate with the Development, QA, and Ops to analyze, debug and resolve design and code issues Establish and maintain a structured testing methodology, especially around automation. Estimate, prioritize, plan, and coordinate testing activities. Effectively communicate status, issues, and risks in a precise and timely manner Skills/Abilities: Strong interpersonal and written communication skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environment Demonstrated ability to work independently, and meet deadlines and commitments in an environment that requires multitasking among concurrent projects Possess a strong desire and ability to learn new skills and take on new initiatives Proven ability to work and have fun in a team environment Qualifications Additional Information

Job_Title: Marketing Director (Regional / APAC/ High Tech industrial)
Job_Descriptions: Job Description: • Be strategic communications business partner to leaders of the sales and marketing  & functional teams (International Key Account Management, Retail processes, HR, IT) across the organization as needed • Develop, implement, and measure various communications plans across stakeholder groups including but not limited to employees, global leadership and external audiences. • Lead content generation that engages and drives measurable action in the region. • Manage agency relationships through the hub team • Put communications in place to create momentum and awareness as well as to test the effectiveness of communications activities • Manage the development, distribution, and maintenance of all print and electronic collateral including, but not limited to, talking points, FAQ, PowerPoint slides, video, social media posts, press releases, website content etc. • Track and measure communication impact on employee engagement • Coordinate and organize town halls, meetings and forums • Build thought leadership communication plans for exec leaders • Support regional and global exec communications as needed • Responsible for issues and crisis communications management • Collaborate with other communications business partners and global communications team to ensure consistency in messaging and alignment of activities Suitable candidates, please email resume in MS word format to **********@recruitexpress.com.sg. Every day, people come to Facebook to connect with friends and family, discover what's going on in the world, interact with businesses, find potential customers, and build community. Facebook’s Global Operations team exists to help them. Within Scaled Operations, GO Markets’ goal is to reduce bad experiences for people—including businesses and advertisers—who use Facebook. We analyze global, local, and language-based trends and nuances and collaborate with other Facebook teams to make changes that help people form stronger, more meaningful connections using our platforms. Our team is seeking a resilient self-starter who is eager to learn, collaborative and a proven team player. We count on specialists who are passionate about protecting users, and are excited to build systems to support millions of people. We value people who can strategically drive the team using macro-level insights, while still caring for micro-level cases affecting people around the globe. You are an intellectually curious and creative individual who is comfortable operating in ambiguity — a strategic thinker with strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills. This position is full time and is based in our Singapore office. As a Market Specialist, be aware of current market events and typical user behaviour of our Filipino community on our platforms Measure and analyse key business metrics to improve our enforcement of Community Standards and increase Facebook’s accountability towards our community of users Gather market specific insights through quantitative and qualitative analysis of benign and abusive content on Facebook and Instagram and use it to develop scalable solutions to support our global Facebook community Communicate market specific insights to cross-functional partners to collaborate and improve our policies, processes and tools Support vendors to understand the impact of policy changes on the team’s current work and surface gaps in policy, process and tools Partner with vendors to ensure that performance feedback is being shared with relevant teams and proactively track the impact and success of remediation plans Liaise closely with our vendors to ensure all operational and business KPIs meet and exceed targets Be the Subject Matter Expert and Go-to-Person for specific, complex business areas Use problem solving skills to resolve large and complex business problems Become and remain knowledgeable about Facebook products and Community Standards Bachelor's Degree 1+ years of professional experience within a tech operations, data or policy environment Strategic thinker with strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills Fluency in Filipino as the successful candidate will be required to translate and appreciate language nuances on our platform 6+ months experience working with data or SQL Your browser doesn't support mapbox-gl library. What the role is You will be part of a dynamic team responsible for planning and managing HR initiatives, particularly in the area of compensation & benefits and scheme reviews. What you will be working on You will be responsible for the following: all compensation and benefits matters, such as the review of the service schemes and starting salaries, as well as payroll and claim matters. manage and implement HR initiatives and policies in the area of performance management to ensure that staff are assessed fairly, duly recognised and rewarded for their contributions. liaise and work closely with MTI divisions as well as HR counterparts in other ministries and agencies to ensure the smooth implementation and administration of the annual Ranking and Promotion (R&P) exercise. oversee the administration of the compensation and rewards systems such as the processing of performance bonus, merit increments, and promotions etc. to ensure that they are effected in a timely manner. ensure regular staff communications to educate supervisors and officers on the appraisal framework and guidelines through HR circulars, conducting briefing sessions and other appropriate platforms. What we are looking for Relevant field of study in Business Administration, Human Resource Management or equivalent disciplines At least 3 years of relevant work experiences, preferably in the area of compensation review, performance management and/or payroll and claims administration. Ability to conceptualise and articulate policies, as well as work well both strategically and operationally Good with numbers and Excel Strong personal initiative and resourcefulness Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Ability to work well with people at all levels

What the role is SENIOR/EXECUTIVE ENGINEER (SOFTWARE DEVELOPER-TEST AUTOMATION) What you will be working on You will be involved in the design and developing the hardware and software solutions to automate the end-to-end testing activities of the integrated e-payment system. You will also develop solutions to test the various fare system projects from the planning stage right up to project completion. With a good understanding of the testing lifecycle, you will identify feasible test cases and automate them such as to be able to effectively optimize the test efforts and improve on test efficiency. To carry out this job role well, you need to be interested and constantly be kept up to date with evolving technologies and innovate feasible solutions to continually improve on test effectiveness and efficiency through automation. This job would also appeal to someone who is inquisitive to find out the root causes of defects and to devise automation means to mitigate the recurrence of similar defects through regression testing. As part of the job, you will be able to learn about the various ticketing systems deployed at Singapore’s public transport and provide valuable contribution to ensure the smooth rollout of new systems and enhancements. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in Information Technology or Engineering At least 3 years of relevant experience in developing solutions involving devices (UI-based or embedded) and/or back-office systems using J2EE, . NET and Selenium/Robot frameworks; Savviness with technology and daring to try innovative automation solutions; Good written and verbal communication skills; Able to work well both independently as well as in a team; Certification in software development or automation frameworks would be an advantage; Experience in micro-payments or Automatic Fare Collection systems using Smart Cards would be an advantage;

Singapore Corporate Banking Department - Business Promotion Overview of Division/Department Business Promotion (BPR), a member of the Singapore Corporate Banking Division comprises of teams who is responsible for promoting and cross-selling the extensive range of the Bank's products and services to our corporate banking customers, and managing We are also Company Profile Mizuho Bank, Ltd. is a subsidiary of the Japan-based Mizuho Financial Group, Inc. (listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange and NYSE) and is one of the largest financial services companies in the world. Mizuho Bank, Ltd. provides financial and strategic solutions for the increasingly diverse and sophisticated needs of its clients with offices located in all the major cities of the world such as Tokyo, New York, London, Hong Kong and Singapore. Job Responsibilities Your key roles & responsibilities include: Planning and managing events for customers such as Mizuho Kai, Mizuho Kai Golf, educational seminars, CSR events, etc. Supporting monthly newsletter issuance i.e. newsletter for Japanese customers Managing budget for Singapore Corporate Banking Department (SPCB) Managing SPCB's subscriptions (magazines, newspaper, online platform, etc.) and vendor payments Job Requirements What you should have: Ability to communicate and write in Japanese language will be preferred, due to frequent engagement with Japanese clients. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Join Mizuho Bank, Ltd., in Singapore, and be part of our expanding team, passionate to build the future together. "One MIZUHO: Building the future with you"

Job_Title: ASSISTANT MANAGER, STRATEGIC COMMUNICATIONS & MEDIA RELATIONS 2
Job_Descriptions: What the role is ASSISTANT MANAGER, STRATEGIC COMMUNICATIONS & MEDIA RELATIONS 2 What you will be working on We are looking for a creative and dynamic professional to join the team to manage the corporate reputation of LTA by communicating appropriate messages and information on LTA’s policies and initiatives to the public through the mass media. Develop and execute media communication strategies and plans for LTA’s initiatives and policies so as to maximise publicity outcomes and deepen public awareness and understanding of our public transport strategies and planning considerations. Initiate consultation with divisions to propose publicity angles that can be communicated to the public Monitor and forecast the development of LTA projects and policies so as to identify and plan suitable opportunities for proactive and reactive publicity Develop and prepare communication materials, such as news releases, presentations, and factsheets to effectively communicate LTA’s initiatives and policies to the media Plan, pitch and facilitate media stories and interviews that help to communicate LTA’s publicity messages clearly and effectively Develop and foster relationships between internal stakeholders and the media so that the media can better understand the scope of LTA’s policies and work Conduct proactive media cultivation and facilitate media access including on-site media management, press conferences and media tours Advise and support LTA departments by providing communications guidance in managing media issues and queries Monitor and analyse prevailing public sentiments on LTA policies and initiatives to identify communications gaps between the public perception and LTA’s positions Develop, anticipate and prepare public positions and responses to queries from the media on LTA’s initiatives and policies Identify potential gaps in the public’s perception of LTA’s initiatives and policies and propose necessary communication activities to bridge these gaps initiate consultation with divisions to develop crisis communications plans and suitable communication strategies to mitigate potential risks. What we are looking for Requirements Tertiary Qualification in Journalism, Mass Communications, English or any related discipline with at least 5 years’ experience in a media or PR organisation, with relevant experience in media relations Experience in crisis communications will be preferred Interest in content creation and social media will be advantageous Good written, verbal and presentation skills Good awareness of current affairs and interest in land transport issues Ability to understand policies and highlight possible public concerns Ability to comprehend and distil complicated policies in order to explain them to the general public

What the role is SENIOR EXECUTIVE, MARKETING COMMUNICATIONS 1 What you will be working on We are looking for a creative and dynamic professional to join the team in promoting and communicating LTA’s policies and projects. As a content producer, you will take the lead in conceptualising, designing and producing impactful yet simple-to-understand content/communication materials (posters, infographics, eDMs, videos, banners, brochures etc), as well as adapt such materials for digital and offline media to promote understanding of LTA’s schemes and projects amongst various audiences. Your job scope will also include providing support for campaigns, administrative work for the department, taking charge of ad-hoc projects and other duties as and when assigned. What we are looking for Requirements Diploma in Communication Design/Graphic Design/Mass Communications or a related discipline At least 3 years’ experience in graphic design work in a mid to large, and dynamic organisation Proven track record for designing and producing impactful  communications materials for digital and offline media Highly proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign etc) Meticulous and possesses a keen eye for details Able to work independently and is also a team player with good interpersonal skills Keen learner, self-motivated and able to work within tight deadlines and under pressure Excellent written and verbal communication skills Good working knowledge of video production and basic photography skills

What the role is The Executive will be part of the IT Services team in Corporate Operations Division (COD). What you will be working on Support and maintain information and communications equipment, and daily operations in COD Prepare and position audio, video conference equipment, projectors and teleconference equipment for video conference, teleconference and recordings Operate video conference software to control audio visual technologies and video conference Sit-in and standby for important video conference events Manning of shared mailbox and respond to user’s enquiries e.g. via email Identify user’s needs, provide relevant information and solutions Liaise with other IT support teams to address the enquiries Maintain records of all correspondences and monitor the status of the enquiries Assist in coordination, implementation and rollout of IT projects What we are looking for Relevant field of study in Information Technology or equivalent At least 1 year of relevant working experience in IT helpdesk support and supporting end-users Good knowledge on desktop computer related settings and configuration for Windows Operating System and Microsoft Office products Good knowledge in ICT technology and equipment e.g. computers, TCP/IP Preferably at least 1 year of relevant working experience in handling video conference equipment and software, e.g. Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Google Meet, Cisco Webex Customer-oriented with good interpersonal and communication skills Good analytical and IT troubleshooting skill Prepared to work after office hours on weekdays, weekends and public holidays, if required

What the role is SENIOR / EXECUTIVE ENGINEER (BUSINESS / SYSTEM ANALYST) What you will be working on You will be part of the requirements team responsible to analyse and establish the users’ requirement based on which features at the Automatic Fare Collection (AFC) system shall be developed for commuters using buses and MRT/LRT. With the implementation of Account-Based Ticketing which allows commuters to pay for public transport fares using credit and debit cards, you will get to understand how the new payment modes are implemented at the bus and rail ticketing systems, and have many opportunities to put in place requirements to fulfil more and evolving user needs. You will work with various stakeholders from within and outside the organization to deliberate on and rationalize through the business and operational needs, to make these into requirements that could be feasibly and sustainably implemented at the system. You will fit well into this job if you are a people person who likes to interact, think, and write systematically, and able to communicate clearly to explain the requirements to different target groups. Elicit and analyse projects’ business and operational requirements and work with systems teams to assess technical feasibility. Establish and document the acquired results of analysis and workflows and obtain sign-off from the relevant stakeholders. These requirement artefacts include high level requirements documents as well as detailed requirement specifications, user interface guides, functional specifications etc which will make clear the various aspects of the requirements. Plan and coordinate discussions with stakeholders and internal teams to conceptualise, elaborate, and confirm the requirements. Communicate clearly to explain the requirements through regular correspondences, walkthroughs and presentations. Validate the correct implementation of the requirements through participating in the verification and validation (testing) activities. Head, Principal Architect Cloud About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Standard Chartered Bank is embarking on a multi-year commercial, corporate and investment banking (CCIB) digital channels transformation journey to digitise client touchpoints, offer world class digital channel services through consistent Omni channels offerings. Bank will seek opportunities to revamp & improve the end to end client journey to improve client experience, technological & operational efficiency. CCIB Digital channels support varying client segments and offers channels services in onboarding, cash, trade finance, custody, financial markets, and core banking. The incumbent will be part of CCIB Solution architecture team and required to work closely with products, business, CIO technology teams to drive innovation, define functional and technical solution architecture designs, own architecture decisions and governance. Cloud Transformation is essential for successful delivery of our business agenda. CCIB aspire to embark on "Cloud First Approach", which means that all new solutions including 3rd party applications are built for the cloud. We aspire to utilize Cloud capacity and flexibility to deal with the expansive growth of Data Architect & Design solutions for cloud which are optimal, secure, efficient, scalable, resilient and reliable, and at the same time. are compliant with banks cloud standards and policies. Providing first-hand solution on cloud technology and bring in controls to onboard the service to the bank. Able to come up with the migration strategy for applications moving from on-premises to cloud. Work collaboratively with the applications teams to understand and assist with application architecture and integration into cloud deployment methodology. Understand end to end migration life cycle and adhere to business defined internal processes and align internal migration teams to the processes. Should be responsible to understand customer requirements, and apply Due Diligence in cyber security requirements Need to have exposure to software technology and adaptability to cloud from Cloud platform / Service, Data platforms, Databases, messaging middleware, SaaS, PaaS, Security services. Hand-on and experienced knowledge of DevSecOps, and automation technologies. The role has to create an impact in making the change in the organization by inculcating the application teams with cloud knowledge, establishing cloud standards, best practices, identifying cloud opportunities, using the experience and the skills set to guide the teams toward migration part. Strategy Responsible for defining the Cloud Strategy for CCIB Domain and the sub-domain. Domain here are Financial Markets, Transaction Banking, Client Coverage, Channels, and the sub-domain references to Cyber, Data, Cloud Come up with the three year Roadmap for the CCID domains on how the cloud adoption be driven seamlessly across Drive the Cloud First Strategy across the domain Processes Responsible for deriving and ensuring Cloud Architecture principles Responsible for Ensuring application teams are adhering, cloud security, technology stack, resiliency and cloud governance principles People and Talent Understand business, functional and non-functional requirements and define solution, technology data, integration architecture and design for digital channels. Engage with various business and technology stakeholders, participate in agile squads to recommend, and finalise architecture design. Manage key stake holders and senior management for architecture decisions and inputs. Govern architecture through design and governance councils, collaborate with enterprise architecture stakeholders. Maintain architecture road maps aligned with business and technology drivers Lead architecture evaluation during RFPs for technology tools and service providers Risk Management Responsible for highlighting any risks related to security and bridging gaps Responsible coming up with the Security risk framework which can be adopted by teams coming on to cloud Identify cloud services which need to go through risk framework for adoption to cloud Governance Responsible for conducting Cloud Technology council meeting for reviewing applications coming on to cloud platforms from the domain Responsible for Documenting patterns libraries which can be adopted by the application teams Responsible for developing security framework which will govern the security aspects for cloud adoption Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Lead to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles : Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Other Responsibilities Making Senior Management Presentations and able to convey Strategy Able to make Confident decisions based on Facts Self-Confident, Flexible and adapt to ever-changing demand and requirements Our Ideal Candidate Master's degree in computer science 10+ years of channels solution architecture role in banking industry directly working with product owners and CIO teams. Minimum of 3 domain business knowledge required in cash, trade finance, custody, financial markets 15+ years of experience in full stack technologies in Web & Mobile, API, JAVA, RDBMS, NOSQL, messaging. Excellent grasp of architecture and design in distributed services architecture, channels security. 5+ years of experience in channels data reporting, dashboards, analytics, data protection, data lakes, data warehouse and cloud technologies Certification on Cloud Architecture, TOGAF, BlockChain, Security Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Job_Title: Business Banking Service Manager - Customer Service Unit
Job_Descriptions: Business Banking Service Manager - Customer Service Unit You will be responsible for servicing corporate customers on account opening, account servicing and handling of trade and credit related products enquiries for small businesses. You will be stationed at our Business Banking Centre or head office on rotational basis, handling customers face-to-face or virtually depending on assignment. The Business Banking Service Manager reports into the Customer Service Unit within Emerging Business. This is a 1-year contract position with the likelihood for conversion to a permanent position if performance is outstanding. You will need to work independently and takes ownership of issues, handle customers' queries professionally and efficiently with the ability to retain huge amount of product and service knowledge. You are expected to be customer centric, be able to identify areas for process improvements to enhance operational efficiency and customer experience. Why join Global Commercial Banking? At Global Commercial Banking we serve and support businesses from micro start-ups to small and medium-sized enterprises in a spectrum of industries with the core mission to help business succeed not just in locally but also internationally. Starting and running a business is never easy. That's where we come in. Our comprehensive and award winning solutions span across banking services such in Cash Management, Trade Services, Financing and Day to Day Operations to beyond banking solutions that aims to help businesses Buy, Sell, Trade, Run and Grow with the competitive edge to win and flourish in this modern economy. Fuelled by your entrepreneurial spirit, your tenacity to challenge the norm, you'll stand at the forefront of partnering SMEs, supporting them throughout their business lifecycle. With SMEs making up 99% of businesses that provide jobs to 7 out of 10 employees in Singapore, #WeSeeYou making real impact in developing these vital building blocks of our country's economy. #WeSeeYou bringing bold business ambitions of young start-ups to life. #WeSeeYou being a pillar for business owners to lean on in times of need and a partner to chart their growth today for a stronger tomorrow. *LI-LW Qualifications You must be passionate about customer service, possess good verbal and written communication skills and be able to work independently with excellent interpersonal skills. Proactive, resilient with strong problem-solving skills You should preferably have a degree or diploma with work experience in a Banking or Customer Service environment

Job_Descriptions: Client Due Diligence Remediation Specialist, COO SG (Associate/Senior Associate) At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! This position within the Singapore COO team is responsible for supporting our Front Office in a multi-year program to uplift the standards of the CDD write-up and documentation for our existing clients. The successful candidate is expected to be knowledgeable in CDD/AML principles to be able to analyse and identify gaps and risks in the existing KYC and Source of Wealth (SoW) information, and to be able to work well within a team while taking initiative and ownership over his/her own area of work. Main Duties Accurately identify gaps (if any) in client's source of wealth and assess the plausibility in line with MAS and the Bank's expectations. Perform detailed calculations to support the client's source of wealth journey, i.e accumulation of wealth over time. Liaise with relationship managers for deficiencies of KYC information and obtain corroboration documentation. Assist relationship managers to succinctly translate the SoW information into a professional and quality write up. Report to the SoW remediation team lead for completion progress on a regular basis and escalate issues to Business Compliance Managers or Compliance where required Coordination and collation of CDD related MIS. Qualifications Work Experience Requirements At least 4 - 8 years of experience in AML and Source of Wealth (SoW) experience for Client Onboarding and Periodic Reviews in a private banking environment. Knowledgeable and sensitive to the risks involved AML risks of private banking clients. Strong analytical writing skills and strong communication skills, including the ability to deal with potentially contentious issues effectively. Familiar with excel and preparation of statistics for reporting. Education Requirements Diploma/ Degree holder ACAMs or ICA would be preferred
